numbered_ace_sentences: 1. The graph shows a percentage of people who believe that the world is getting better.
2. A higher percentage of people who are 15-24 years old believe that the world is getting better.
3. Many third-world nations are more optimistic about the world improving.
4. If a third-world nation is more optimistic, then the nation receives more support or the nation develops faster.
6. If a person gets older, then the person becomes less optimistic about the world.
7. This pattern shows that experiences have a tremendous impact on the way people view the world.
8. I wondered why some countries appear to be more optimistic than other countries.
9. I belong to the younger generation.
10. I am affected by this situation.
11. Most communities are affected by this situation.
12. The world will change over time.
13. The younger generation will cause the world to change over time.
14. The title is: Which Generations Believe in the Future?
